body:
Is it patronizing male privilege and hyper-toxic masculinity that made me send you all this? Probably.

But isn't it sweet that I remembered?
body_html:
Is it patronizing male privilege and hyper-toxic masculinity that made me send you all this? Probably.

But isn't it sweet that I remembered?

body: Because they have a stronger support system, financially, emotionally, and socially? All other things being equal, it's pretty logical that someone who has a life partner they chose at some point, and that they spend a good chunk of their days with, would be happier than someone who does not.
body_html: Because they have a stronger support system, financially, emotionally, and socially? All other things being equal, it's pretty logical that someone who has a life partner they chose at some point, and that they spend a good chunk of their days with, would be happier than someone who does not.

body:
>Regular church/temple attendance increases “very happy” reports by 9%. People who feel “God” is the center of marriage goes up by 25%. **This has more to do with these people being commitment oriented than religious, per se.**

This is really important and often overlooked. Beginning a marriage with aligned values and morals will almost certainly set you up for success. Save a significant trauma such as the loss of a child or adultery, these are the marriages that succeeded.
body_html:
Regular church/temple attendance increases “very happy” reports by 9%. People who feel “God” is the center of marriage goes up by 25%. This has more to do with these people being commitment oriented than religious, per se.

This is really important and often overlooked. Beginning a marriage with aligned values and morals will almost certainly set you up for success. Save a significant trauma such as the loss of a child or adultery, these are the marriages that succeeded.

body: Me too but that's extremely rare, and I may not even count because I'm not really interested in having a partner. And for me the whole thing is flipped, I also don't like abuse otherwise and get extremely ticked at how men are always expected to give and never receive, while women are allowed to always receive and never give. And even though it doesn't seem to affect me, it still affects how people treat you quite a lot. And even my own body and brain. I'm still a disposable machine good for nothing but working for society and treating women.
body_html: Me too but that's extremely rare, and I may not even count because I'm not really interested in having a partner. And for me the whole thing is flipped, I also don't like abuse otherwise and get extremely ticked at how men are always expected to give and never receive, while women are allowed to always receive and never give.
